1.rationale:
Looking at our current head at (6,1), we have three possible safe moves (excluding RIGHT because that cell is occupied by our body):

• UP → moves us to (6,2). That’s open, but it doesn’t score an apple.
• LEFT → moves us to (5,1), which is also open, but away from any immediate apple.
• DOWN → moves us to (6,0) where there’s an apple.

One tempting goal in a Snake game is to increase in size and points, and here the apple at (6,0) is immediately available. Although moving DOWN puts us against the bottom edge, the immediate reward (growing and gaining a point) is appealing. With careful play, we can maneuver even from the edge. Also, note that the enemy snake is currently at (5,0) with their body extending to (4,0), (3,0) and so on, so our move to (6,0) should be safe from a collision.

Thus, after considering the board state and the strategic benefit of eating an apple, the next move is DOWN.

Decided next move: DOWN.

0.rationale:
Let’s map out the immediate options from our head at (5,0):

• RIGHT → (6,0): there’s an apple there. Eating it nets +1 and it’s unoccupied by any snake body now.  
• UP    → (5,1): free, but no apple.  
• LEFT  → (4,0): that’s our own body. Dead end.  
• DOWN  → (5,-1): off‐board. Illegal.  

Taking RIGHT to grab (6,0) is both safe this turn and gets us points. After that, we can pivot north and follow the remaining cluster at (3,7),(4,9),(2,6),(1,5).  

Next move: RIGHT
